question: According to the ancient Indian geographical concept, ‘Bharatvarsha’ was a part of which of the following dweepas?
explanation: The Jambudweepa and Bhartavarsha were part of same island as per Vedic cosmology. According to our Indian geography in the ancient times, the entire landmass in the northern hemisphere was encircled by ocean in all the directions. This giant land mass on earth was called Jambudvipa. In Sanskrit language dwipa means an Island.  Jambudweep is the first Island among the innumerable concentric Islands of the Middle Universe.
